titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of his cartoons at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MD

list.item: 6 Jan 2010 - added bio, scope and detailed inventory (SK)

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Walt Munson was an American sports cartoonist and illustrator.

Munson worked as a cartoonist for the New Haven Register from approximately the early 1940s through 1974. Prior to this, he drew the single panel cartoon,
Such is Life and illustrated comic postcards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
Walt Munson Cartoons are divided into two series.
Cartoons (1965-1970, undated) contains 27 original sports cartoons produced for the New Haven Register. A variety of sports are caricatured, however Munson's attention is frequently on college sports played by Yale University and other Ivy League teams.

Sixteen cartoons have dates stamped on the back. The cartoons vary in size with the largest measuring approximately 11 1/2" x 17 1/2". The cartoons were drawn primarily with ink on illustration board and Graphix paper. Some were drawn with crayon and traces of pencil are visible.
Proofs and Tearsheet (1970, undated) contains 7 items. Several are about the interruption of college sporting events by campus protests and demonstrations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Dated items are arranged in chronological order and undated items are arranged in alphabetical order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has collections of over one hundred cartoonists. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
